title: Ajit Pawar Plane Crash: Ajay Devgn, Anupam Kher Mourn Dy CM's Death, Pay Tribute
text:
As Maharashtra woke up to the shock of losing Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, tributes began pouring in from across the country. Among the many voices expressing grief were Bollywood actors Ajay Devgn and Anupam Kher, who shared emotional messages remembering the senior leader and offering condolences to his family. The tragic news has deeply affected both political and entertainment circles, with many describing the loss as sudden and difficult to process.

Ajay Devgn says he is â€˜shocked and saddenedâ€™

Ajay Devgn took to X, formerly known as Twitter, to express his grief over Ajit Pawarâ€™s death. In his post, the actor wrote, â€œShocked and saddened by the tragic passing of Hon. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar ji. My heartfelt condolences to his family, loved ones and all those affected by this immense loss. Om Shanti."

Shocked and saddened by the tragic passing of Hon. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar ji. My heartfelt condolences to his family, loved ones and all those affected by this immense loss. Om Shanti ğŸ™ğŸ»â€” Ajay Devgn (@ajaydevgn)January 28, 2026

Anupam Kher remembers Pawar as warm and humane

Actor Anupam Kher also shared a heartfelt tribute, remembering Ajit Pawar for his personal warmth and kindness. In his condolence message, Kher wrote:

â€œDeeply saddened by the untimely passing of Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar Dada. A leader who always came across as warm, gracious, and humane in my interactions with him. His loss leaves a deep void. My heartfelt condolences to his family and loved ones. Om Shanti ğŸ™ğŸ•‰"

Deeply shocked and Saddened by the tragic passing of Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar dada. Whenever I met him he was very gentle and kind! My thoughts are with his family. Om Shanti! ğŸ™ğŸ•‰pic.twitter.com/X0deqc6Z0Wâ€” Anupam Kher (@AnupamPKher)January 28, 2026

Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister and NCP chief Ajit Pawar, along with five others, died in a plane crash near Baramati on Wednesday. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) confirmed that all six passengers on board lost their lives. The aircraft crashed during the landing phase near Baramati around 9 a.m., roughly an hour after taking off from Mumbai. Ajit Pawar was travelling to attend a public meeting amid ongoing Zilla Parishad and Panchayat Samiti elections.

Emergency services and senior officials rushed to the site soon after the crash. Three bodies were taken to Baramati Medical College, with identification underway. DGCA officials have reached the spot to investigate the incident, while locals were among the first to gather at the site.
